title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: members, contributors, leaders pledge make participation community harassment-free experience everyone, regardless age, body size, visible invisible disability, ethnicity, sex characteristics, gender identity expression, level experience, education, socio-economic status, nationality, personal appearance, race, religion, sexual identity orientation. pledge act interact ways contribute open, welcoming, diverse, inclusive, healthy community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Examples behavior contributes positive environment community include: Demonstrating empathy kindness toward people respectful differing opinions, viewpoints, experiences Giving gracefully accepting constructive feedback Accepting responsibility apologizing affected mistakes, learning experience Focusing best just us individuals, overall community Examples unacceptable behavior include: use sexualized language imagery, sexual attention advances kind Trolling, insulting derogatory comments, personal political attacks Public private harassment Publishing others’ private information, physical email address, without explicit permission conduct reasonably considered inappropriate professional setting

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders responsible clarifying enforcing standards acceptable behavior take appropriate fair corrective action response behavior deem inappropriate, threatening, offensive, harmful. Community leaders right responsibility remove, edit, reject comments, commits, code, wiki edits, issues, contributions aligned Code Conduct, communicate reasons moderation decisions appropriate.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct applies within community spaces, also applies individual officially representing community public spaces. Examples representing community include using official e-mail address, posting via official social media account, acting appointed representative online offline event.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Instances abusive, harassing, otherwise unacceptable behavior may reported community leaders responsible enforcement [INSERT CONTACT METHOD]. complaints reviewed investigated promptly fairly. community leaders obligated respect privacy security reporter incident.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders follow Community Impact Guidelines determining consequences action deem violation Code Conduct:

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Use inappropriate language behavior deemed unprofessional unwelcome community. Consequence: private, written warning community leaders, providing clarity around nature violation explanation behavior inappropriate. public apology may requested.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: violation single incident series actions. Consequence: warning consequences continued behavior. interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, specified period time. includes avoiding interactions community spaces well external channels like social media. Violating terms may lead temporary permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: serious violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior. Consequence: temporary ban sort interaction public communication community specified period time. public private interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, allowed period. Violating terms may lead permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Demonstrating pattern violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior, harassment individual, aggression toward disparagement classes individuals. Consequence: permanent ban sort public interaction within community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct adapted Contributor Covenant, version 2.0, available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/version/2/0/ code_of_conduct.html. Community Impact Guidelines inspired Mozilla’s code conduct enforcement ladder. answers common questions code conduct, see FAQ https://www.contributor-covenant.org/faq. Translations available https:// www.contributor-covenant.org/translations.

title: Data and Function to Work with Emojis
text: main data set package emojis data set contains almost information contained package. emoji_name vector emojis descriptive names emojis zero keywords associated . can use emoji_keyword together emoji_name show emojis keyword.
code: library(emoji)  emojis #> # A tibble: 4,702 × 19 #>    emoji name  group subgr…¹ version points nrunes runes quali…² vendo…³ vendo…⁴ #>    <chr> <chr> <chr> <chr>   <chr>   <list>  <int> <chr> <chr>   <lgl>   <lgl>   #>  1 😀    grin… Smil… face-s… 1.0     <int>       1 1F600 fully-… TRUE    TRUE    #>  2 😃    grin… Smil… face-s… 0.6     <int>       1 1F603 fully-… TRUE    TRUE    #>  3 😄    grin… Smil… face-s… 0.6     <int>       1 1F604 fully-… TRUE    TRUE    #>  4 😁    beam… Smil… face-s… 0.6     <int>       1 1F601 fully-… TRUE    TRUE    #>  5 😆    grin… Smil… face-s… 0.6     <int>       1 1F606 fully-… TRUE    TRUE    #>  6 😅    grin… Smil… face-s… 0.6     <int>       1 1F605 fully-… TRUE    TRUE    #>  7 🤣    roll… Smil… face-s… 3.0     <int>       1 1F923 fully-… TRUE    TRUE    #>  8 😂    face… Smil… face-s… 0.6     <int>       1 1F602 fully-… TRUE    TRUE    #>  9 🙂    slig… Smil… face-s… 1.0     <int>       1 1F642 fully-… TRUE    TRUE    #> 10 🙃    upsi… Smil… face-s… 1.0     <int>       1 1F643 fully-… TRUE    TRUE    #> # … with 4,692 more rows, 8 more variables: vendor_twitter <lgl>, #> #   vendor_one <lgl>, vendor_facebook <lgl>, vendor_messenger <lgl>, #> #   vendor_samsung <lgl>, vendor_windows <lgl>, keywords <list>, #> #   aliases <list>, and abbreviated variable names ¹​subgroup, ²​qualified, #> #   ³​vendor_apple, ⁴​vendor_google emoji_name[1:10] #>                        grinning                   grinning_face  #>                            "😀"                            "😀"  #>                          smiley     grinning_face_with_big_eyes  #>                            "😃"                            "😃"  #>                           smile grinning_face_with_smiling_eyes  #>                            "😄"                            "😄"  #> #>  #> $arriving #> [1] "flight_arrival" #>  #> $arrow #>  [1] "cupid"                     "calling"                   #>  [3] "envelope_with_arrow"       "bow_and_arrow"             #>  [5] "up_arrow"                  "up_right_arrow"            #>  [7] "right_arrow"               "down_right_arrow"          #>  [9] "down_arrow"                "down_left_arrow"           #> [11] "left_arrow"                "up_left_arrow"             #> [13] "up_down_arrow"             "right_arrow_curving_left"  #> [15] "left_arrow_curving_right"  "right_arrow_curving_up"    #> [17] "right_arrow_curving_down"  "arrows_clockwise"          #> [19] "arrows_counterclockwise"   "back"                      #> [21] "end"                       "on"                        #> [23] "soon"                      "top"                       #> [25] "twisted_rightwards_arrows" "repeat"                    #> [27] "repeat_one"                "play_button"               #> [29] "fast_forward"              "reverse_button"            #> [31] "rewind"                    "last_track_button"         #> [33] "arrow_up_small"            "arrow_double_up"           #> [35] "arrow_down_small"          "arrow_double_down"         #>  #> $art #> [1] "performing_arts" "art" lapply(emoji_keyword[c(150:155)], function(x) unname(emoji_name[x])) #> $Aries #> [1] "🐏" "♈" #>  #> $army #> [1] "🪖" #>  #> $arrivals #> [1] "🛬" #>  #> $arriving #> [1] "🛬" #>  #> $arrow #>  [1] "💘" "📲" "📩" "🏹" "⬆️"  "↗️"  "➡️"  "↘️"  "⬇️"  "↙️"  "⬅️"  "↖️"  "↕️"  "↩️"  "↪️"  #> [16] "⤴️"  "⤵️"  "🔃" "🔄" "🔙" "🔚" "🔛" "🔜" "🔝" what: Calculate the number of days in the synodic month — day_in_synodic_cycle
title: Calculate the number of days in the synodic month — day_in_synodic_cycle
text: uses approximation described lunar phase wikipedia page, .e. number days since 1900/01/01 modulo length synodic month (29.530588853 days)

Calculate the number of days in the synodic month — day_in_synodic_cycle
text: date date

title: Calculate the number of days in the synodic month — day_in_synodic_cycle
Find a single emoji — emoji
text: function starts looking exact matches emoji_name. none found emoji_name looks emoji_keyword. emoji_keyword can produce 1 matches, lead one returned random.

title: Find a single emoji — emoji
text: keyword Character, either name keyword. one emoji specified keyword, pick one random.

title: Find a single emoji — emoji
text: function vectorized thus work 1 keyword time.

title: Count the number of emojis in a string — emoji_count
code: string <- paste(c(letters[1:4], emoji_name[1:6]), collapse = " ")  emoji_count(string) #> [1] 6  emoji_count(emoji_name[1:6]) #> [1] 1 1 1 1 1 1

text: string Input vector. simplify see stringr::str_extract_all()

text: character vector

title: Extract emojis from a string — emoji_extract
code: chars <- c(letters[1:4], emoji_name[1:6])  set.seed(1234)  strings <- lapply(1:10, function(x) paste(sample(chars, x), collapse = ""))  extracts <- emoji_extract(strings)  all_extracts <- emoji_extract_all(strings)

code: emoji_find("happy") #> # A tibble: 5 × 2 #>   name         emoji #>   <chr>        <chr> #> 1 grinning     😀    #> 2 smiley       😃    #> 3 smile        😄    #> 4 laughing     😆    #> 5 raising_hand 🙋    emoji_find("cat") #> # A tibble: 12 × 2 #>    name            emoji #>    <chr>           <chr> #>  1 smiley_cat      😺    #>  2 smile_cat       😸    #>  3 joy_cat         😹    #>  4 heart_eyes_cat  😻    #>  5 smirk_cat       😼    #>  6 kissing_cat     😽    #>  7 scream_cat      🙀    #>  8 crying_cat_face 😿    #>  9 pouting_cat     😾    #> 10 cat             🐱    #> 11 cat2            🐈    #> 12 black_cat       🐈‍⬛    emoji_find("family") #> # A tibble: 26 × 2 #>    name                       emoji #>    <chr>                      <chr> #>  1 family                     👪    #>  2 family_man_woman_boy       👨‍👩‍👦    #>  3 family_man_woman_girl      👨‍👩‍👧    #>  4 family_man_woman_girl_boy  👨‍👩‍👧‍👦    #>  5 family_man_woman_boy_boy   👨‍👩‍👦‍👦    #>  6 family_man_woman_girl_girl 👨‍👩‍👧‍👧    #>  7 family_man_man_boy         👨‍👨‍👦    #>  8 family_man_man_girl        👨‍👨‍👧    #>  9 family_man_man_girl_boy    👨‍👨‍👧‍👦    #> 10 family_man_man_boy_boy     👨‍👨‍👦‍👦    #> # … with 16 more rows

what: Turn emojis into qualified emojis — emoji_fix
title: Turn emojis into qualified emojis — emoji_fix
text: emojis can written multiple different ways either fully-qualified, minimally-qualified, unqualified. emoji_fix() take emoji return fully-qualified version emoji.

title: Turn emojis into qualified emojis — emoji_fix
Turn emojis into qualified emojis — emoji_fix
text: x Characters, vector emojis.

title: Turn emojis into qualified emojis — emoji_fix
text: vector fully-qualified emojis

title: Turn emojis into qualified emojis — emoji_fix
text: function vectorized.

title: Turn emojis into qualified emojis — emoji_fix
code: unqualified_ind <- which(emojis$qualified == "unqualified")[1:10] unqualified <- emojis$emoji[unqualified_ind]  unqualified #>  [1] "☺"           "☹"           "☠"           "❣"           "❤‍🔥"         #>  [6] "❤‍\U{01fa79}" "❤"           "🕳"           "👁‍🗨️"          "👁️‍🗨"          emoji_fix(unqualified) #>  [1] "☺️"           "☹️"           "☠️"           "❣️"           "❤️‍🔥"         #>  [6] "❤️‍\U{01fa79}" "❤️"           "🕳️"           "👁️‍🗨️"          "👁️‍🗨️"

title: Glue Interpolation for Emojis — emoji_glue
text: Combine power glue::glue emoji().

title: Glue Interpolation for Emojis — emoji_glue
text: ... [expressions] Unnamed arguments taken expression string(s) format. Multiple inputs concatenated together formatting. Named arguments taken temporary variables available substitution. .envir [environment: parent.frame()] Environment evaluate expression . Expressions evaluated left right. .x environment, expressions evaluated environment .envir ignored. NULL passed, equivalent emptyenv().

title: Glue Interpolation for Emojis — emoji_glue
text: glue::glue() string.

title: Glue Interpolation for Emojis — emoji_glue
text: emoji_glue() behaves much way lot messaging apps work. Anything inside pair : interpolated emoji. can think emoji_glue() shorthand glue("love {emoji('taco')}s"). Block ending * collapsed.

title: Glue Interpolation for Emojis — emoji_glue
code: emoji_glue("I love :taco:s") #> I love 🌮s  emoji_glue("one :heart:") #> one ❤️ emoji_glue("many :heart*:") #> many 😻💌💘💟❤️‍🔥❤️🤎🤍🫰🫀🩺

code: waving_hands <- emojis$emoji[grepl("waving hand", emojis$name)] waving_hands #> [1] "👋"   "👋🏻" "👋🏼" "👋🏽" "👋🏾" "👋🏿"  emoji_modifier_extract(waving_hands) #> [[1]] #> NULL #>  #> [[2]] #> [1] "light skin tone" #>  #> [[3]] #> [1] "medium-light skin tone" #>  #> [[4]] #> [1] "medium skin tone" #>  #> [[5]] #> [1] "medium-dark skin tone" #>  #> [[6]] #> [1] "dark skin tone" #>   set.seed(1234) emoji_sample <- sample(emojis$emoji, 10) emoji_sample #>  [1] "👨🏻‍⚕"                     "👩‍\U{01f9b3}"              #>  [3] "👩🏾‍🤝‍👨🏼"                "🤦🏿"                      #>  [5] "🇨🇼"                        "\U{01f9d1}🏼‍❤️‍\U{01f9d1}🏾" #>  [7] "\U{01f9d6}‍♀"               "🦍"                        #>  [9] "👩‍❤️‍💋‍👨"                   "🏋🏻‍♂"                       emoji_modifier_extract(emoji_sample) #> [[1]] #> [1] "light skin tone" #>  #> [[2]] #> [1] "white hair" #>  #> [[3]] #> [1] "medium-dark skin tone"  "medium-light skin tone" #>  #> [[4]] #> [1] "dark skin tone" #>  #> [[5]] #> NULL #>  #> [[6]] #> [1] "person"                 "person"                 "medium-light skin tone" #> [4] "medium-dark skin tone"  #>  #> [[7]] #> NULL #>  #> [[8]] #> NULL #>  #> [[9]] #> [1] "woman" "man"   #>  #> [[10]] #> [1] "light skin tone" #>

title: Keep strings containing an emoji, or find positions — emoji_subset
text: string input vector negate TRUE, return non-matching elements.

title: Keep strings containing an emoji, or find positions — emoji_subset
text: character vector

title: Keep strings containing an emoji, or find positions — emoji_subset
code: string <- c(letters[1:4], emoji_name[1:6])  emoji_subset(string) == emoji_name[1:6] #>                        grinning                   grinning_face  #>                            TRUE                            TRUE  #>                          smiley     grinning_face_with_big_eyes  #>                            TRUE                            TRUE  #>                           smile grinning_face_with_smiling_eyes  #>                            TRUE                            TRUE  emoji_subset(string, negate = TRUE) #> [1] "a" "b" "c" "d"  emoji_which(string) #> [1]  5  6  7  8  9 10 emoji_which(string, negate = TRUE) #> [1] 1 2 3 4

title: Full List of Emojis — emojis
text: data set heart emoji package. contains various information regarding avaiable emojis v15.0.

title: Full List of Emojis — emojis
text: tibble 19 columns nrow(emojis) rows emoji character representation emoji name name group group, e.g. "Smileys & People" subgroup sub group, e.g. "face-positive" version version emoji introduced points Decimal Code Point(s) nrunes number runes emoji uses runes vector unicode runes, .e. hexadecimal representations prefixed "U+" qualified Status emoji, can one 4 types; "component", "fully-qualified", "minimally-qualified", "unqualified". See details . vendor_* apple ... windows logical indicating given vendor supports emoji keywords vector keywords keywords vector aliases

title: Full List of Emojis — emojis
text: Unicode® Full Emoji Charts v15.0 Unicode® Emoji Charts v15.0 Unicode® Emoji Ordering, v15.0 https://github.com/github/gemoji https://github.com/muan/emojilib

title: Full List of Emojis — emojis
text: levels qualified following meaining component: Emoji_Component, excluding Regional_Indicators, ASCII, non-Emoji. fully-qualified: fully-qualified emoji (see ED-18 UTS #51), excluding Emoji_Component minimally-qualified: minimally-qualified emoji (see ED-18a UTS #51) unqualified: unqualified emoji (See ED-19 UTS #51)

title: emoji 15.0
text: Package version now reflect emoji version set Unicode. Updated data include Emoji v15.0. Added emoji_modifiers data set information emojis modifiers. Added emoji_modifier_extract() extract modifiers emojis. (#8) Added emoji_modifier_remove() remove modifiers emojis. (#7) Added zoo() randomly sample animal emojis. (#10)

title: emoji 0.2.0
text: CRAN release: 2021-09-18 Updated data include Emoji v14.0. emoji_name now includes aliases. Adding emoji() emoji_find() can used return emojis based keywords. Added emoji_fix() turns emojis qualified emojis. Added arrow(), clock(), flag(), keycap(), medal(), moon(), shape() serving shorthand groups emojis. Added emoji_glue() glue interpolation.

title: emoji 0.1.0
text: CRAN release: 2021-07-27 Added NEWS.md file track changes package.
